eventType.name: Student Groups
eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: Yale Undergraduate Quantum Computing
eventData.description:
The Yale undergraduate Quantum Computing (YuQC) group is a network of peers working to better understand and leverage principles of Quantum Computation. Yale has notably driven innovation at the frontiers of quantum information science for the past few decades. Our student organization was thus formed out of a necessity to bridge the gap between Yale’s vibrant graduate research community in quantum engineering and the potential quantum scientists in its undergraduate student body.

YuQC is fundamentally an organization that brings together students in the pursuit of knowledge and interdisciplinary innovation. To accomplish the breadth of our goals, we are thus committed to fostering an inclusive environment that best supports the diversity of our talented membership.

Come join our Yale undergraduate Quantum Computing Group Social. Learn more at yaleqc.com and qchack.io.

eventType.name: Student Groups
eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: Thomastic Institute at Yale
eventData.description:
The Thomistic Institute exists to promote Catholic truth in our contemporary world by strengthening the intellectual formation of Christians at universities, in the Church, and in the wider public square. The thought of St. Thomas Aquinas, the Universal Doctor of the Church, is our touchstone.

The Thomistic Institute is part of the Pontifical Faculty of the Immaculate Conception at the Dominican House of Studies in Washington, DC. Join us for a Zoom Q&A!

eventType.name: Student Groups
eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: Davenport Pops Orchestra
eventData.description:
The Davenport Pops Orchestra, affectionately known as DPops, is Yale’s only pops orchestra. DPops is entirely student run, featuring student conductors, student board, student arrangers, and student musicians.

Come meet and chat with some members of DPops! Just drop by anytime during the hour to ask questions and learn more about DPops (this isn't a super formal event). We're really excited to meet with you and answer any questions you have about the orchestra :D

eventType.name: Student Groups
eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: Greet and Gather with Yale Students for Christ
eventData.description:
Get to know students from diverse backgrounds about navigating faith at Yale. Current students will share what following God has looked like, from finding Christian community to integrating faith and academics. We’d love to connect and describe more what it has looked like to live out faith, hope and love in our campus, city and world.

For more info, check out: yalestudentsforchrist.org or email staff@yalestudentsforchrist.org

eventType.name: Student Groups
eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: Chinese Adopted Siblings Program
eventData.description:
A joint project of the Chinese American Students Association (CASA) and the Taiwanese American Society (TAS), CASPY is a bi-annual cultural event held on Yale’s campus that seeks to inform Chinese adoptees and their parents about Chinese culture. Two times a year, in the spring and the fall, we invite you to join us for a full day of fun activities and events in our Kids, Teens, and Parent Programs.

Participating children are paired with Yale “Big Sibs” and placed into the Kids and Teens Programs. Highlights from past programs include Night Market with games and prizes, Calligraphy Workshop with Professor Su Wei, and different culinary activities with delicious food. Parents attend meaningful panels and discussions to connect with each other and to explore the many faceted topics surrounding adoption.

Into session for Yale's Chinese Adopted Siblings Program for Youth. We will introduce our biannual CASPY Day event for Chinese-born transracial adoptees in the tri-state area and follow with an open discussion for the Asian-American transracial community at Yale. Discussion topics will include identity building for Asian Americans, particularly for adoptees, as well as conflicts (cultural, mental, familial) that may arise while learning about oneself.

eventType.name: Student Groups
eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: Distilled Periodical
eventData.description:
Distilled Periodical is a student-run annual publication focused on analysis of pressing real-world issues from a variety of perspectives, ranging from the sciences (social, natural, and physical) to the humanities. Our extended editorial process allows writers to work closely with a small group of editors to distill complex problems and articulate ideas drawing from diverse areas of knowledge. We welcome students of all academic interests and experience levels.

Are you passionate about topics that don't fit neatly into a single discipline? Are you interested in writing or editing but intimidated by the process? Do you like art? Come learn more about Distilled, our extended editorial process, and how to promote change through writing!

As a plus, join to participate in a raffle

eventType.name: Student Groups
eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: Women and Gender Minorities in Comp Sci
eventData.description:
We are a group dedicated to creating a supportive community on campus for women and gender minorities interested in computer science. We include everyone from life long coders to non-majors looking to learn coding! Each year, we host a variety of events including social events to build our community, professional events to help prepare our members for future opportunities like jobs and internships, and events to aid our members with their academics.

Come learn about Yale Women and Gender Minorities in Computer Science! Ask questions about WGiCS, being a women in CS, or CS at Yale in general and play some games/brain teasers.

eventType.name: Student Groups
eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: Yale Dramatic Association
eventData.description:
The Yale Dramat is an undergraduate theatre organisation that produces seven shows a year,  ranging from professionally directed and designed mainstays to their FroShow, which is produced and performed entirely by first-year students. The Dramat and has over a hundred undergraduate members. and thousands of prominent alumni working in a variety of fields.

Come and meet students from across the Dramat community, including members of our Executive and Associate Boards, students currently acting in our shows, as well as production and technical team members. We'd love to answer any questions you have about getting involved with the Dramat, our productions, our history, and anything else that you'd like to hear from us about!

eventType.name: Student Groups
eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: Yale Mixed Martial Arts Club
eventData.description:
We are the Yale Mixed Martial Arts Club. Formed by combining the former Muay Thai Kickboxing Club and Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu Club, we focus on all aspects of the fighting arts; stand-up striking, ground fighting, submissions, etc. We welcome people of all experience levels and fighting backgrounds (if any), and want to create a community where people can share and learn about martial arts from each other. All equipment provided, sparring is optional. Only requirement is that you come prepared to work out a sweat!

Q&A session about the club, martial arts in general, or just about life. We'd love to get to know you all not just as fighters, but as members of the club family!

eventType.name: Student Groups
eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: Broad Recognition
eventData.description:
Broad Recognition (www.broadsatyale.com) is an intersectional feminist student magazine at Yale. We are a radically progressive collective of friends, writers, and thinkers dedicated to understanding the way power impacts our communities. We seek to use our writing as a platform for understanding the world around us with the hopes of ultimately overturning the status quo. We dream of a world centered around communities of love instead of economies of capital.

This will be an open space to learn about Broad Recognition and our work. Meet current Broads writers and learn how to get more involved!
